message: Check out this project. Paul O'Shannessy and some other guys have been implementing a V8 API on top of SpiderMonkey to in turn be able to use SpiderMonkey as the JS engine for Node. For now it seems the project is called SpiderNode, but I guess they aim for a merge with Node in the future, letting the people choose which engine they want to use. http://blog.zpao.com/post/4620873765/about-that-hybrid-v8monkey-engine
